" Shannon-Fano coding is a lossless data compression technique devised by Claude Shannon and Robert Fano.
" "This method construct a prefix code based on a set of symbols and their probabilities.
" "It guarantees that all code word lengths are within one bit of their theoretical ideal .

"1. Rearrange the symbols in descending order of appearance probability from low probability.

" "2. Split it in two places where the sum of the probabilities of each set is as equal as possible.

" "3. Assign "0" to one of the divided sets and "1" to the other set, and make it the first digit of the code.

" "4. Each of the two sets formed by division is further divided into two, and 0 and 1 are assigned in the same way.

" " This operation is performed until the number of symbols included in each set becomes one.
